Daniel Schifano

A ridesharing application that rivals Uber

Product Lead - Arcade City - 2016

Worked with Product Owner and team members to create a ridesharing application to rival Uber.

First steps were to identify who our competitors were and how we could differ from their product. This led us to analyze the application from key points of interaction.

Understanding the driver and rider experience

After we outlined the key goals for the driver we did the same for the rider user.

Many applications have a product team focusing on one key user whether that be a customer or IT. In this case we had to think about two entirely different users that have seperate motivations

Prototying some concepts

Once we decided that we had key goals defined for every flow in the application, we began prototyping.

The rider flow allows the user to set a pickup location, set pickup details and request a ride. Riders can easily become drivers as well and that is easily accesible through the menu.

The driver flow allows the user to go online and offline, to accept or ignore incoming requests and to be able to notify the rider that they are on their way to the pickup location.

All designs were made available through an interactive prototype that was used to validate with users.
